title: Business & Finance
text:
---

Global companies have racked up more than $59 billion in losses from their Russian operations, according to a review of public statements and securities filings.

---

The SEC is investigating Goldman's asset-management arm over its funds that aim to invest based on environmental, social and governance standards.

---

Meta 's investigation of Sandberg's use of corporate resources is examining behavior going back several years, said people familiar with the matter.

---

Tesla plans a 3-for-1 stock split, joining other companies with lofty share prices that have taken such a step.

---

Revlon is preparing to file for chapter 11 bankruptcy protection as soon as next week, people familiar with the matter said.
